ArticleTitle.sentence: Control of NF-kappa B activity by the I kappa B beta inhibitor.

event.clue: Control of NF-kappa B activity by the I kappa B beta inhibitor.

AbstractText.sentence: The transcription factor NF-kappa B is maintained in an inactive cytoplasmic state by I kappa B inhibitors.

event.clue: The transcription factor NF-kappa B is maintained in an inactive cytoplasmic state by I kappa B inhibitors.

AbstractText.sentence: In mammalian cells, I kappa B alpha and I kappa B beta proteins have been purified and shown to be the inhibitors of NF-kappa B through their association with the p65 or c-Rel subunits.

AbstractText.sentence: In addition, we have isolated a third NF-kappa B inhibitor, I kappa B epsilon (1).
Upon treatment with a large variety of inducers, I kappa B alpha, I kappa B beta are proteolytically degraded, resulting in NF-kappa B translocation into the nucleus.

AbstractText.sentence: Here we show that in E29.1 T cell hybridoma I kappa B alpha and I kappa B beta are equally associated with p65 and that I kappa B beta is degraded in response to TNF alpha in contrast to what has been originally published.

event.clue: Here we show that in E29.1 T cell hybridoma I kappa B alpha and I kappa B beta are equally associated with p65 and that I kappa B beta is degraded in response to TNF alpha in contrast to what has been originally published.

AbstractText.sentence: Our data also suggest that, unlike I kappa B alpha, I kappa B beta is constitutively phosphorylated and resynthesized as a hypophosphorylated form.

AbstractText.sentence: The absence of slow migrating forms of I kappa B beta following stimulation suggests that the phosphorylation does not necessarily constitute the signal-induced event which targets the molecule for proteolysis.

event.clue: The absence of slow migrating forms of I kappa B beta following stimulation suggests that the phosphorylation does not necessarily constitute the signal-induced event which targets the molecule for proteolysis.
